item.description: Heard in our house tonight: “No, Kate, why are you putting spinach on your toes?!”
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Eventually, my daughters are going to discover that I am not, in fact, cool. I’m going to enjoy it as long as it lasts.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: I am increasingly persuaded that there is a law of the universe which states: On any morning in which parents intend to sleep in at all, their children will awaken early, and with an overabundance of energy.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Parenting skills: seeing the projectile vomit beginning, and sidestepping so it only gets on the floor.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: This week Kate learned to walk. Also, she decided to go on a goldfish-and-hotdogs-only food strike, and to wake up at 11pm and cry, shout, and scream for over an hour multiple nights this week. You win some, you lose some?
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Observation: it is extremely difficult to compose when you have a(n adorable) one-year-old competing for the piano keys…
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Ellie and Kate consistently get up half an hour to an hour earlier on Saturday mornings than any other day of the week. Coincidentally—or is it?—Saturday is also the only day we try to sleep in. It’s like they know, and plot against us!
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: A minute ago, Ellie asked me to play with her and Kate. I started to answer, “No, I need to finish publishing Winning Slowly.” Then I remembered: putting that first would be pretty much exactly the opposite of Winning Slowly.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description:
I want so much to grind some of this single-origin decaf coffee and drink it right now.

But my 1-year-old is asleep downstairs.

So: nope.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Kate kept us up late last night (no idea why). And we ran out of coffee yesterday. It’s going to be a long day…
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Our youngest has been sleeping through the night for a week now. Going to bed at 9:45 & getting up at 5:15 is suddenly doable again. Huzzah!
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: Snow Days and Friends Moving
item.description:
Another month gone, another bunch of little changes, and a few bigger changes, too.

February marked the final burst of winter here. We had a number of days of wintry weather, leading to several days where Southeastern’s campus was closed—though none on days when I had class! One …
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: The State of Our Family in Early 2015
item.description: It has been a long time since I wrote a family update here, and I skipped the Christmas letter this year because I was exhausted. I resolved at the beginning of the year to write at least one update every month, though. I want these updates here for myself, if …
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: Whiplash
item.description: Get a big contract—jubilation! Watch your daughter almost choke to death—terror!
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho
